page.title: 02Local History
page.content: The{Rath}is located about 3 miles from Aughnacloy, close to{Rehaghy {mountain. }The{Rath}was once used as a {hill-top fort}so the enemy was easily seen if they were going to attack, and had a{moat}around it for protection. It is circular shaped with a hollow centre. The fort has been used by Irish farmers in ancient times to safe-guard their homes and livestock. The fort has survived for hundreds of years as the farmers who owned the land never removed it from their fields at Rehaghy although it now serves no useful purpose. Perhaps they want to preserve this memory of our ancient past. Today the{Rath}is surrounded by trees such as Elms, Holly and Oak. In the centre of the fort there are various plants and flowers for example Primroses and violets.
